content.description: Sit start matched on the arete. From there, follow the arete to its apex, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the east face arete of Kumite.

content.description: Sit start with a low, left hand bump and a right hand on the arete. From there, follow the arete to the boulder's apex and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a large rock directly behind the topout.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Kumite's northeast arete.

content.description:
Oxiclaw is a morpho, one-move wonder that climbs a beautiful slab.

Swing stand start with a three-finger, left hand sidepull and a triangular, right hand bump (almost nothing).  From there, find a decent edge for a foot, and pop up (my one foot definitely pushed off the ground) to the diagonal rail (crux).  At that point, follow the rail out right to the lip and top it out.

The top out is dirty but solid from what I experienced.  I trundled a fair amount of loose rock from the top, but there may still be some loose holds though.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the North face of Kumite Boulder.

content.description:
Ministry Moans ascends a solid, slab arete by incorporating some interesting movement.

Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand on a crimp five feet off the ground.  From there, bump the left up the arete, move the the right up to the shelf, do some technical footwork, gain a great left hand sidepull, mantle with the right, match a foot next to that hand (crux), and finish up the slab/arete for the top out.
content.protection: A pad or two should suffice; the landing is great, but there are some tree branches behind the problem.
content.location: This ascends the North face of Kumite Boulder.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Eddie Vedder Voice Calibrator

, traverse left using the crimps, and top out (more like a side out).

Sit start with a low left hand on a bump and a right hand on the arete. From there, stick a left hand triangular undercling and a right hand on a large jug at the arete, reach the second rail that traverses the face, follow it out left for an easy finish.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot, a large rock sits behind the problem.
content.location: This climbs the East face of Kumite Boulder.
